resources.string: Enter the email address used to sign up for your account to receive instructions on how to reset your password.

At Permanent, we celebrate our members\' hard work through our public gallery and archive spotlights. Explore our gallery and, when you\'re ready, publish or share your own public archive.

To disable two-step verification, you must remove all existing two-step verification methods you have previously added.

Automatically approve requests for share access.
Archives are granted access with this role by default.
Show a thumbnail of this shared item to link recipients.
The link will disappear after this number of uses has been reached.
The link will disappear after the expiration date has been reached.
Owner: Curator plus permission to add new members and change owners
Manager: A member with all file and folder permissions and the permission to modify membership
Curator: Editor plus permission to move, copy and delete records
Editor: Contributor plus permission to edit record metadata and to change folder views
Contributor: Viewer plus permission to create file and folder records (e.g. upload only)
Viewer: A member with permission to view records only
This account already has access to the Permanent Archive
There is already a pending owner for this Permanent Archive
You cannot change the access level of the Permanent Archive owner
Permanent Archives can only have one owner at a time. Once this is complete, your role will be changed to Curator
This link is no longer available
Give a gig, get a gig
Invite your friends and family and both of your accounts will be credited with one free gigabyte of storage when they sign up.
Current password is incorrect. Please try again.
Password must be at least 8 characters in length.
There was a problem saving the location.
%s accepted your invitation to join the %s as a %s

Please note: deleting your account will remove all reference to personally identifiable and contact information as well as payment options you have provided to us in your account settings.

The account deletion action will not delete any archives that you own or personally identifiable information in the records stored in those archives. Any archives you own that are not deleted prior to deleting your account will become orphaned archives. Archives can only be deleted by logging in to your account on Permanent.org.

(Learn more here.)[https://desk.zoho.com/portal/permanent/en/kb/articles/how-to-delete-an-archive]

When you are ready, type ‘DELETE’ in all caps and press confirm below to confirm account deletion.
Type DELETE with all caps in order to delete your account.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this archive?
In order to access this content you need to switch to The %s Archive
Enter search terms to match tags and titles.
Purchase as little or as much at a time, anytime you\'d like.
You need to add a payment card first.

You’ve just taken the first step on a journey to preserving what matters the most to you by creating archives that can represent yourself, your family, or your community.\n\nNext, you’ll create your first archive. A Permanent archive is the collection of digital materials about an individual, family or group, or organizational entity.

You’ve been invited to collaborate on an archive as an archive member. A Permanent archive is the collection of digital materials about an individual, family or group, or organizational entity. Get started by accepting an invitation, or by creating a new archive of your own.

Congratulations! You’ve joined %s archives. The last step is to choose which archive to set as your default, the first one you’ll see when you log in. Select your default archive below, or create a new one of your own to be your default.
Create Your First Archive: Select Type

You’ve just taken the first step on a journey to preserving what matters the most to you by creating archives that can represent yourself, your family, or your community.

Next, you’ll create your first archive. A Permanent archive is the collection of digital materials about an individual, family or group, or organizational entity.

What type of archive will this be? You can always change this later.
Create Your First Archive: Name Your Archive

What is your new archive called?\n\nThis is generally the legal or official name of the person, family, or organization the archive is about — for example, “The Katherine Johnson Archive.” You can always edit your archive’s name later.
represents an individual person, such as yourself or someone else
any group of people, such as a community group or a family
an organizational entity, such as a company or nonprofit

We’re so glad you’re here!

At Permanent, it is our mission to provide a safe and secure place to store, preserve, and share the digital legacy of all people, whether that's for you or for your friends, family, interests or organizations.

We know that starting this journey can sometimes be overwhelming, but don’t worry. We’re here to help you every step of the way.

You’ve been invited to collaborate on an archive as an archive member. A Permanent archive is the collection of digital materials about an individual, family or group, or organizational entity. Get started by accepting an invitation, or by creating a new archive of your own.
What do you plan to capture and preserve with your first archive?
Create an archive that captures my personal life journey.
Create an archive that captures a person’s life journey.
Create an archive that captures my family life.
Create an archive that captures my family history.
Create an archive that captures a community\'s life.
Create an archive that captures an organization\'s life.
Name your new archive. This is the formal or official name of the person, family, group, or organization the archive represents. You can edit the name later if needed.
Let’s set some goals. Everyone has unique goals for preserving their legacy. We want to learn more about how we can help you achieve yours.\n\nMy goal is to…
Finally, we’re curious…\nWhat brought you to Permanent.org?
Get started by uploading your first files, or learn more about your new archive by
Capture and preserve memories for storytelling
Digitize or transfer my materials securely
Collaborate with others to build my archive
Create a public archive to share a legacy
Share my archive with others securely
Create a plan for passing on my digital materials
Access to a safe and secure digital storage platform
Preserving family history or genealogy research
Collaborate with a family member, friend, or colleague
Upload selected files to this destination:
Upload a publicly viewable copy of these items in your Public workspace and get a public link to share with anyone.

Moving files or folders outside of the shared folder in which they are currently located is not permitted at this time. You can cancel this move action or continue to choose a destination for the selected item.
Failed to sign up. Please try again!
Are you sure you want to delete the tags from all items in the current archive?
Decide when your account becomes inactive and what happens to your files. Share them with trusted people or have us delete them.

Your Legacy Plan will determine when, how, and with whom your materials will be shared. Your Legacy Plan has two parts. First, decide when Permanent should consider your account to be inactive by creating an Account Legacy Plan. Second, decide what happens to the materials in your Archives by creating an Archive Legacy Plan for each of them.
You have not yet set a Legacy Plan for your Permanent account.
After creating an Account Legacy Plan, you may create a Legacy Plan for each of the individual archives owned by your account.
Set up my Account Plan now
Tell me more about Legacy Planning
In the event of your death or incapacitation, the following Legacy contact can activate your Legacy Plan:
Your archive will be transferred to the following archive steward:
Who will reach out to Permanent to let us know of your death or incapacitation?
A trusted person who can inform Permanent about your death or long term disability.
Who should be the owner of this archive in the event of your death or incapacitation?
The Archive steward will receive a note when your Legacy Plan is activated.
Choose someone to be your legacy contact to save your account legacy plan.

Permanent will send an automatic email to your Legacy Contact to inform them that they have been designated to activate your Account Legacy Plan, alongside instructions on how to do so. However, we strongly recommend that you also discuss your Legacy Plan with this person.
In order to designate someone as a steward for your archive, they must have a Permanent.org account.
Thank you for being the steward of my archive. I appreciate you taking care of my legacy when I am gone.

Your Archive Steward will get an email from Permanent with instructions. Discuss your Legacy Plan first. They\'ll receive another email when the plan is activated with steps to accept ownership. Add instructions in the note section above.
Your Legacy Plan will determine when, how, and with whom your materials will be shared.
Send storage to existing users or invite someone new with a gift. Recipients must create an account to claim a gift.

Enter your Permanent account password to continue adding a two-step verification method.
The Permanent app may be briefly unavailable on
for routine maintenance.\nThank you for your patience.
Enter your email address and click the button to send a one-time use code.
Enter your phone number and click the button to send a one-time use code. At this time, we can only accept North American cell phone numbers for text message verification.
